Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery slightly ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially grey-black in section, the interior is thickly covered with a dark grey-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of three lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394616) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394616)
